title: Corrections & Amplifications
description: Corrections & Amplifications for the edition of July 13, 2023.

title: 'Succession' Dominates Emmy Nominations for the Last Time
description: The nominee announcements come as Hollywood is embroiled in major labor disputes that have hobbled production and possibly the awards ceremony itself.

title: Cracking the Proxy Advisory Duopoly
description: Glass Lewis and ISS have a 97% market share and conflicts of interest.

title: Inflation Isn't Conquered Yet
description: Real wages have only begun to increase, and the Fed isn’t done.

title: Canada Is a Military Free-Rider in NATO
description: Ottawa still spends only a pathetic 1.38% of GDP on defense.

title: The Pentagon's Abortion War With Tommy Tuberville
description: The Republican Senator should lift his hold on promotions, but this fight over social policy erodes support for the military.

title: A Great, Destructive Migrant Mess
description: Biden’s open river or another Trump wall will stop the clock on American preeminence.

title: Joe From Scranton Loses His Authenticity
description: The kind, folksy everyman he ran as in 2020 wouldn’t shun his granddaughter.

title: I Don't Know How to Say My Own Last Name
description: The proper pronunciation of ‘Hroncich’ got lost in America’s melting pot.

title: 'Completely Mad' Review: Across the Ocean With an Oar
description: Tom McClean faced frostbite, nonstop gales and waves that looked like skyscrapers. A 15-foot shark followed him for days. He named it Bluey.

title: 'Norman Foster' Review: From Blueprints to Modern Marvels
description: An exhibition at the Pompidou Center follows the futuristic architect’s stylistic and technical evolution, between factories and bridges, airports and skyscrapers.

title: Only Weapons Can End the Ukraine War
description: Europe should provide humanitarian aid so the U.S. can provide tanks, F-16s and artillery shells.

title: When Character Mattered in Washington
description: An insistence on decency in presidential candidates might be a start to restoring national political life to a respectable level.

title: Emmy Awards 2023: WSJ's TV Critic on This Year's Nominees
description: Contenders for top prizes include Hulu’s kitchen dramedy ‘The Bear,’ HBO’s ‘Game of Thrones’ prequel, and the final seasons of ‘Ted Lasso’ and ‘The Marvelous Mrs. Maisel.’

title: Disney Extends CEO Robert Iger's Contract Through 2026
description: The entertainment giant’s board unanimously voted to extend his contract by two years.

title: 70 Years Later, This Is Still the Best Summer Dessert
description: Our writer’s fascination with old-school desserts has won him a huge TikTok following—but for him, one mid-century summertime treat packs a particularly poignant punch.

title: Colorado Music Festival Review: Rachmaninoff in the Rockies
description: Boulder’s six-week event celebrated the Russian composer this past weekend in programs led by renowned music director Peter Oundjian and pianist Nikolai Lugansky.

title: Does Gen X Have No Style?
description: Plenty of fashion memes mock boomers, millennials and Gen Z. But the forgotten generation has seemingly evaded online snark. One Xer wonders what, if anything, defines her peers’ look today.

title: Stocks Rally After Cooler Inflation Report
description: Inflation eased to 3% in June, the lowest level since 2021.

title: The Art Market Hits a Wall
description: Christie’s sold $3.2 billion in art during the first half of 2023, a 23% drop from the year before as sellers held onto more of their art trophies.

title: Fed's Neel Kashkari Ponders 'High-Inflation Stress Test' for Banks
description: The Minneapolis Fed leader said “bank stress could emerge again” if the central bank needs to leave interest rates elevated to fight inflation.

title: Payroll Services Provider UKG Agrees to $6 Million Settlement in Data-Breach Lawsuit
description: The company will compensate breach victims after a 2021 ransomware attack.

title: U.S., Russian Spy Chiefs Spoke to One Another, But What About?
description: The U.S. and Russia gave different accounts of a talk between the CIA’s William Burns and the head of Russia’s foreign intelligence service.

title: Drop Everything! (Thursday Crossword, July 13)
Tampa: Why Gen Z and Millennial Tourists Are Flocking to This Retirement Mecca
description: Miami? Passe. Thanks to an influx of young travelers and residents drawn by its food and bar scene—and its walkability—this sleepy Sun Belt city is waking up fast.

title: Elon Musk Launches xAI, His New Artificial-Intelligence Company
description: Musk has been recruiting researchers to try to create a rival to OpenAI, the AI company behind the viral chatbot ChatGPT.

title: How Much More Expensive Is a Long Weekend at the Beach This Summer?
description: From a pet sitter to parking at the airport, here’s how inflation has changed prices since last year.

title: The '80s Espresso Martini Is Back. Gen X Asks: Why?
description: Decades after its first turn in the spotlight, this trendy cocktail has been co-opted by Gen Z. Here, a rich, full-flavored version that pleases everyone.

title: Stockholdings of Federal Executives Would Be Easier to Track Under New Bill
description: Legislation by Chuck Grassley and Gary Peters for a searchable database of financial holdings was triggered by The Wall Street Journal’s Capital Assets series.

title: Tommy Tuberville Goes on Defense Over Hold on Military Promotions, Racial Comments
description: The Alabama Republican senator has thrown a roadblock in front of promotions for all senior military officers, and came under fire over his comments about white supremacists in the military.

title: Bank of Canada Seems Increasingly Worried About Sticky Core Inflation
description: The Bank of Canada is expressing deeper concern about the stickiness in elevated core inflation, says Sebastien Lavoie, chief economist at Laurentian Bank Securities.

title: Soft U.S. Inflation Supports Recession Concerns
description: Interest rate increases by the Federal Reserve take 12 to 18 months to have an impact on the U.S. economy, Torsten Slok, chief economist at Apollo Global Management, writes in a note, pointing to a likely recession.

title: U.S. Natural-Gas Inventories Seen Higher in Week
description: U.S. government are expected to show that natural-gas inventories rose last week by 52 billion cubic feet, a below-normal amount, as cooling demand increased amid hot temperatures.

title: Russia's Nukes After Putin
description: Prigozhin’s mutiny has the U.S. wondering if the 6,000 warheads would be secure in a shakeup.

title: Florida's New Law Helps Investors Consider Real ESG
description: Environmental, social and governance factors can be material but it’s obscured by political histrionics.

title: 'They're Coming for Your Cars'
description: Even if politicians can push us all into e-vehicles, they will have to be small and scarce to achieve emissions goals.

title: Microsoft's Win Puts U.K. Regulator in Challenging Spot Over Activision Deal
description: Britain’s antitrust watchdog, the only major regulator preventing the deal from closing, says it is ready to consider a new proposal.

title: Chinese Hackers Spied on State Department
description: The State Department was among the federal agencies to be compromised in a suspected Chinese hacking campaign, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Domino's Investors Overpay for a Pizza the Action
description: The pizza chain’s Uber deal is an acknowledgment that Domino’s could no longer go it alone. Investors should applaud its flexibility, but not quite so loudly.

title: U.S. Crude-Oil and Diesel Fuel Inventories Rise Sharply
description: Stockpiles jumped by 5.9 million barrels last week to 458.1 million barrels. Analysts had predicted stockpiles to slip by 100,000 barrels.

title: What Is Florida to Do About the Border Crisis?
description: Ignoring immigration law isn’t the solution.

title: Seattle's Taxes and the Flight From Blue States
description: The failures of progressive policy can be held up to scrutiny only if progressives face political competition.

title: U.S. Takes Third Shot at Shoring Up Money-Market Funds
description: The SEC voted to adopt tougher rules as money funds’ holdings balloon this year.

title: What Randi Weingarten Leaves Out of the Story
description: The teachers-union boss’s deflections aren’t convincing.

title: Volunteer in Retirement---if You Can Get the Time Off
description: Men, women and finding meaning.

title: If You Like Broadway and Cruises (and Are Between 19 and 90), This Vacation's for You
description: Cruise enthusiasts can skew older, but these popular voyages bring together musical theater fans of every generation–not to mention Tony-winning performers like Kristin Chenoweth and Alan Cumming.

title: When NATO Met the Ugly American
description: President Trump told the Europeans something they didn’t want to hear.

title: California Respects Its Veterans
description: Even at the supermarket parking lot.

title: Emmy Nominations Come Amid Turmoil in Hollywood
description: The announcement comes as Hollywood is embroiled in major labor disputes that have hobbled production and possibly the awards ceremony itself.

title: Hire a 'Body Double' to Stop Your Procrastinating
description: Body doubling is one of several ways that workers are trying to regain focus and accountability when they’re not under the watchful eyes of bosses and colleagues in the office.

title: What to Know About Justice Sotomayor's Books and Ethics Questions
description: How the U.S. Supreme Court came to say that Justice Sonia Sotomayor had failed to recuse herself from considering some appeals involving her publisher, Penguin Random House.

title: When Parents Want to Pass Down Furniture You Hate: An Awkward True Story
description: An admittedly ungrateful daughter recalls the delicate push and pull of fending off her mother’s beloved secretary desk.

title: Bank of Canada Lifts Interest Rates, Warns Path to Stable Inflation at Risk
description: Canada’s central bank raised its main rate to 5%, saying it would take longer to reach 2% inflation due to stronger-than-expected growth.

title: The Morning Risk Report
description: Bank of America ordered to pay $250 million over wrongful fees, fake accounts. And, Merrill Lynch to Pay $12 million for failing to file hundreds of suspicious activity reports

title: Corporate Boards Are Disclosing More on Diversity of Directors --- ESG Insight
Record-Breaking Heat Waves Set to Bake South and Southwest
description: More than 82 million Americans were under an excessive heat warning or a heat advisory Wednesday morning, according to the National Weather Service.

title: Satellite Images Show Extent of Catastrophic Flooding in Vermont
description: Before and after satellite images revealed extensive damage across Vermont after days of persistent rain unleashed historic flooding. A dam near Montpelier neared capacity but isn’t expected to spill over.

title: Iowa Lawmakers Pass Six-Week Abortion Ban
description: State joins a number of other Republican-led states that have moved to limit abortion access.

title: How Fast Can Inflation Cool? Not Fast Enough (Yet) for the Fed
description: It looks as if inflation will keep cooling. With hope, it will be without the Federal Reserve furthering its efforts to speed the process along.

title: Canada Confronts Allegations of China-Led Electoral Interference
description: The claims have roiled Prime Minister Justin Trudeau’s government, prompting calls for tighter monitoring of foreign-interference threats and a probe of the alleged activities.

title: Traders Think July Rate Rise Could Be Fed's Last
description: Odds of the Federal Reserve raising rates twice more this year look less likely after inflation promisingly cooled.

title: Traders Think July Hike Could Be Fed's Last
description: Odds of the Federal Reserve raising rates twice more this year look less likely after inflation promisingly cooled.

title: Wray Faces Grilling From Republicans on House Committee
description: The FBI director was set to forcefully defend his workforce in testimony before Congress, where he is expected to face a grilling from Republicans.

title: World's Strangest Double Feature: 'Barbie,' then 'Oppenheimer'
description: ‘Watching Barbie first is more unhinged than sleeping in jeans.’ Meet the ‘Barbenheimer’ debate.

title: This Part of Bidenomics Needs More Economics
description: Massive sums are being spent on industrial policy with little guidance from economic theory or research.

title: UAW Nixes Symbolic CEO Handshakes as Labor Talks Begin
description: In forgoing the ceremonial handshake, the union is signaling a more aggressive tone for contract negotiations with GM, Ford and Stellantis.

title: How Markets Are Reacting, in Charts
description: Take a look at how various assets are moving after the release of the June consumer-price index: U.S. stock futures, bond yields, oil, gold and the dollar.

title: Charts: How Markets Are Reacting
description: Take a look at how various assets are moving after the release of the June consumer-price index.

title: Natural Gas Falls After 2-Day Surge
description: Natural gas prices fell on profit-taking after a nearly 6% rise over the past two sessions.

title: Health Care Roundup: Market Talk
description: The latest Market Talks covering the Health Care sector.

title: Financial Services Roundup: Market Talk
description: ANZ, Nordea and more in the latest Market Talks covering Financial Services.

title: Inflation Is Likely Lowest Since Early 2021---but Still Too Hot for Fed
description: Officials are focused on reducing stubborn underlying price pressures as they consider raising interest rates this month.

title: Energy & Utilities Roundup: Market Talk
description: Mitsui, Centrica and more in the latest Market Talks covering Energy and Utilities.

title: Basic Materials Roundup: Market Talk
description: Evonik, Anglo-American and more in the latest Market Talks covering Basic Materials.

title: Auto & Transport Roundup: Market Talk
description: Ryanair, Heathrow Airport and more in the latest Market Talks covering the Auto and Transport sector.

title: Today's Logistics Report: Retail's Sales Bellwether; Driving Into Mining; Building Chip Ecosystems
Brazilian Meatpacker JBS to Pursue U.S. Listing
description: The company intends to list its shares on the NYSE and the São Paulo Stock Exchange using Brazilian Depository Receipts by the end of 2023.

title: Tech, Media & Telecom Roundup: Market Talk
description: Dish Network, Electronic Arts and more in the latest Market Talks covering Technology, Media and Telecom.

title: ChatGPT Already Floods Some Corners of Internet With Spam
description: Online publishers have been inundated with junk-article pitches as websites using AI-generated content multiply.

title: College Sports Powers Stall Bid to Share Revenue With Athletes in California
description: A bill to share with players revenue from college football and basketball programs in California was diverted by big conferences that argued it would hurt female athletes and sports programs such as swimming.

title: Credit Scores Rose in Pandemic. Now, More Borrowers Are Slipping.
description: Government stimulus checks and loan deferrals drove up scores, making it harder for banks to tell who is creditworthy.

title: How McDonald's Turned Grimace Into TikTok Gold
description: The fuzzy purple character has become a social-media celebrity, thanks to a birthday-themed marketing campaign and a berry-flavored milkshake.

title: Cordillera Raises $443 Million to Back Niche Alternative Investments
description: Alligator farming, whiskey barrels and music royalties are among the sectors targeted by the investment manager.

title: U.K. Lenders Pass Stress Test but BOE Flags Risks
description: The Bank of England’s latest assessment of financial stability found that U.K. major banks could withstand a sharp economic downturn, but highlighted risks stemming from the real-estate sector and leverage.

title: Why More Retailers Are Willing to Pick Up Returns From Your Doorstep
description: The pandemic has changed the way we shop. More people buying things online means more people returning things, too. WSJ’s Dalvin Brown explains how some companies are leveraging gig workers to make those returns for you.

title: Lina Khan Is Taking on the World's Biggest Tech Companies---and Losing
description: The FTC chair’s court loss against Microsoft marks another setback in her fight to block mergers.

title: Domino's Pizza Strikes Deal With Uber
description: The pizza chain hopes to generate $1 billion in sales after losing business to food-delivery apps.

title: NYC to Consider Indoor Air Quality Regulations
description: Two bills lawmakers are bringing forward would require the city to create standards to measure, monitor, report and enforce air quality inside schools and municipal buildings.

title: Venture Firm General Catalyst Seeks Bigger Funds Despite Market Downturn
Illumina Fined More Than $400 Million in Europe for Closing Grail Deal Early
description: The European Union’s antitrust watchdog fined the company with the maximum allowable amount for wrapping up its acquisition of the cancer-test developer while the agency was still reviewing it.

title: Alpine Investors Defies Fundraising Slowdown With $4.5 Billion Buyout Fund
description: The technology-focused firm’s ninth main private-equity fund roughly doubles the amount raised by its predecessor in 2021.

title: The Ukrainian Mom on the Brink of the Wimbledon Final
description: Elena Svitolina, who needed a wild-card invitation to the tournament after giving birth nine months ago, defeated world No. 1 Iga Swiatek in three sets on Tuesday.

title: AT&T and Verizon Knew About Toxic Lead Cables---and Did Little
description: For decades, telecom companies have known that lead in their networks posed risks to workers and could leach into the environment.

title: AT&T and Verizon Knew About Toxic Lead Cables---and Did Little
description: For decades, telecom companies have known that lead in their networks posed risks to workers and could leach into the environment.

title: A Hiker Died With a Bullet in His Chest. Why Did Police Say He Was Stabbed by a Stick?
description: A rural Washington sheriff’s office is accused of bungling the investigation of Aron Christensen’s death and faking an exit wound on his dog Buzzo.

title: Inflation Is Likely Lowest Since Early 2021---but Still Too Hot for Fed
description: Officials are focused on reducing stubborn underlying price pressures as they consider raising interest rates this month.

title: Lead Legacy
Extreme Heat Wave Sweeps Across Southern U.S.
description: Triple-digit temperatures are forecast over large parts of the South and Southwest in the coming days, said the National Weather Service. The NWS forecast that numerous high temperature records will be broken.

title: Ukraine Gets Defense Pledge From West After NATO Disappointment
description: The largely symbolic declaration from G-7 nations comes as NATO reaffirmed security pledges to Ukraine but disappointed its leaders by not putting a timeline on its eventual membership.

title: Negotiators See Global Deal on Taxing Tech Firms Within Reach
description: An agreement would reallocate taxation of about $200 billion in profits; failure could lead some nations to impose their own levies on companies.

title: Rebuilding Trust in Carbon Offsets Faces Uphill Battle
description: Around 95% of buyers today don’t meet new standards on carbon offsets.

title: German Schatz Yield Seen Falling in Coming Months
description: A long position in two-year German Schatz could be appropriate for investors who believe the ECB has only one more 25 bps interest-rate rise in store, Natixis said, expecting the two-year Schatz yield at 2.9% by the end of September.

title: DNB Beats Views, Backs Outlook
description: DNB reported an above-forecast second-quarter profit and net interest income on profitable growth in lending and deposits and higher interest rates, and reiterated its financial targets.

title: Thales Expands Avionics with Cobham Aerospace Buy
description: Thales has entered into exclusive negotiations to buy France-based Cobham Aerospace Communications for an enterprise value of $1.1 billion and said the acquisition is expected to bring yearly double-digit EBIT growth in the medium term.

title: North Korea Launches Suspected Long-Range Missile
description: Pyongyang has expressed outrage toward the U.S. in recent days over a variety of issues.

title: U.S. Government Emails Hacked in Suspected Chinese Espionage Campaign
description: The penetration is being viewed as part of an espionage campaign that potentially compromised valuable information.

title: Cluster Munitions Approved for Ukraine: Here's Why They're So Destructive
description: The Biden administration said it plans to send cluster munitions to Ukraine to bolster the country’s offensive against Russian forces. WSJ explains the technology behind the weapons and why they’ve raised humanitarian concerns.

title: The Things Hotels Still Can't Get Right
description: Travelers are paying more for hotels but often getting less, from problems with pools to missing food and drink items on menus, even at high-end lodging.

title: London's Canary Wharf Takes Brunt of Real-Estate Pain
description: Empty offices, remote working and corporate tenants fleeing to buzzier parts of the U.K. capital are all hitting the 30-year-old business district.

title: Masked Gunmen and a Stolen Toilet: How Russia Seized a Ukrainian City's Businesses
description: Many of Melitopol’s companies have been taken over by Russian interests. Now some former owners are fighting back.

title: Big Automakers Grab $1 Billion Deal for Urgently Needed Battery Metals
description: Volkswagen and Jeep maker Stellantis are each committing $100 million in a complicated transaction that will create a publicly traded mining company producing nickel and copper.

title: Havas Takes Majority Stake in Creative Agency Uncommon
description: The deal represents a bet that top marketing creative talent can outperform AI

title: RBA's Lowe Begins Implementing Review Plan
description: The changes include reducing the number of policy meetings to eight from 11 a year from next year, and pledging to hold press conferences after each decision on interest rates is made.

title: Measure It Differently, and Inflation Is Behind Us
description: Gauge U.S. price changes the way Europe does, and inflation was already just below 3% in May.

title: Catastrophic Flooding Swamps Vermont
description: Photo: Ian Thomas Jansen-Lonnquist for the Wall Street Journal

title: The Longevity Clinic Will See You Now---for $100,000
description: The clinics cater to a growing number of people obsessed with fighting aging.

title: JPY Strengthens on Speculation of Carry-Trade Unwinding
description: JPY strengthened against most other G-10 and Asian currencies on speculation of unwinding of carry trades.

title: Gold Edges Up on Prospects for Cooling U.S. Inflation
description: Gold edged higher in the early morning Asian session on prospects that U.S. data due out later will show cooling inflation.

title: Oil Futures Steady, Supported by USD Weakness
description: Oil futures were steady in the early morning Asian session, supported by weakness of USD, which typically has an inverse correlation with oil.
